summary: This is an email chain from July 2, 2019, among FBI personnel discussing the immediate operational response to the indictment and arrest warrant for Jeffrey Epstein in the Southern District of New York. It details plans for his arrest upon return to the U.S., execution of a search warrant at his NYC residence, interviews with co-conspirators, and deployment of agents to Florida to serve subpoenas.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email; indicted in SDNY with an arrest warrant sworn out. Believed to be in France at the time.

persons.name: Lenny
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the email sender spoke with about the recipient's availability for the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: Lenny, as an FBI contact, is involved in planning the operational response to Epstein's indictment and arrest.

events.title: Epstein Indicted in SDNY
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York and an arrest warrant was sworn out.

events.title: Planning for Epstein's Arrest and Searches
events.description: FBI personnel coordinate to be on standby to arrest Epstein upon his return to the U.S., execute a search warrant at his NYC residence, interview co-conspirators, and deploy agents to Florida to serve subpoenas.

keyFacts: On July 2, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York and an arrest warrant was issued.
At the time of the email, Epstein was believed to be in France, and the FBI planned to arrest him immediately upon his return to the United States.
The FBI's operational plan included executing a search warrant at Epstein's New York City residence and interviewing co-conspirators.
The FBI also planned to deploy two agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and attempt to interview 1-3 individuals there.
The email chain shows FBI personnel coordinating their availability for these time-sensitive investigative actions around the July 4th holiday weekend.
